findings.title: Saving large JSON integers could result in interoperability issues
findings.description: The parsing of JSON integers generated by the deposit tool differs from mainstream implementations such as NodeJS and jq.

findings.title: They allow leakage of mnemonic phrases (TOB-EF-DEP-001)
findings.description: The Deposit CLI tool generates a random mnemonic phrase and outputs it to the terminal for the user to copy, but the terminal buffer is not properly cleared, allowing the phrase to be recovered later. Additionally, the clipboard is not blocked and is never cleared, leaving the phrase in the clipboard for an indefinite period of time.

findings.title: passwords
findings.description: Add a validation check on passwords to ensure minimum length.

findings.title: encrypted keys (TOB-EF-DEP-002)
findings.description: Use a password strength library/entropy calculator on user passwords to enforce use of strong passwords.

findings.title: High-Severity Issues in Compilation and Distribution of Deposit Tool
findings.description: Two high-severity issues are related to the compilation (TOB-EF-DEP-005) and distribution (TOB-EF-DEP-001) of the deposit tool.

findings.title: Passwords are accessible via shell history
findings.description: The Deposit CLI tool allows passwords to be supplied as command-line arguments, enabling password leakage through operating systems such as terminal shell history and execution of `ps` or similar commands.
